content.description: Follow the bolt line up the left side of the middle tier face on slanty holds.  The crux on the first pitch is getting over the gap by either following crack up right or maneuvering directly over gap. Proceed up easy face climbing to your pick of 3 top anchors (to left of bush, right/under bush, and above bush).  If continuing on to 2nd pitch the anchors above the bush provide a nice belay ledge.  There are variations on the second pitch to get up to the ridge - the bolted route to the left from the belay station above the bush is a sustained 5.10a with blocky vertical holds.
content.protection: 10-12 quick draws. There are a couple options for top anchors on the first pitch and the second pitch will take you up to the top of the ridge with anchors to rappel off (3 rappels and you're back on the ground).
content.location:
To the left of

Burning Bush

. Starts out towards the low double bolts.

content.description: Once you have ascended the first waterfall, look to your left. You will see 2 bolted lines headed towards a rather large block/ledge. Both are on excellent rock, although the second pitch is rather loose. Definitely wear helmets on this climb.
content.protection: Bolts all the way up. 2 bolts with quick links at the top.
content.location: The start is on a loose dirt hill side. There is a bolt down low for the belayer to anchor to. The start is on small crimps, real fun though. The route to the left is a 2 pitch, but be careful when pulling the mantal right above the 2nd belay station there are a lot of loose rocks.

content.description: Start from the loose earth ledge, there are camouflaged bolts low for the belayer (a nice touch). Starts on thin hands, through a few tricky fun moves. Around the 3-4th bolt you hit the crux with upslide down holds and a bulge. Once you pull the bulge you are on easier slab climbing to the anchors.
content.protection: Sport route, with anchors at the top, this is a two pitch route, although you should absolutely bring a helmet for the second pitch because about 10 feet above the anchors you have to pull onto a rather large ledge littered with big blocks, just waiting to fall on your belayer.
content.location: Climb up the first wall/waterfall. Once on top look to your left the routes are on the wall to your left (west). There is multipitch potential on the massive headwall above you, although I am not sure they have been put up for all lines.

content.description: A high quality line for full value at 100'. Use the fixed line to approach the far left bolted belay. Climb the face tending left up to the obvious roof. Pull the roof (easier than looks) then finish up easier face to the anchor left of the stump.
content.location: On the left side of middle tier you will see a fixed line linking the belay stations. Use the far left belay and climb the leftmost route. Can be extended to bird ledge to continue up the Head Wall.
